name: 1.15 "Father Knows Last" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 1 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Coach say the DMV asked him to do?
questions.explanation:
donate his kidneys.

	Coach didn't realize that the DMV always asks people about donating organs. He thought the prices had gotten really high.

questions.text: Who was the first person to say that Carla was pregnant?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane's exact words were, "Carla is with child". Coach replied with, "The cat's out of the bag". Carla had been pregnant for a while but no one wanted to bring it up until she did.

questions.text: Why did Norm say he didn't have children?
questions.correct: "I just look at Vera and I can't."
options: "Children are so hard to raise in today's society."
"Vera looks at me and she can't."
questions.explanation:
"I just look at Vera and I can't."

	Norm was constantly poking fun at his wife Vera. Vera's face was never seen on the show. The closest was the Thanksgiving episode in which she was hit with a pie so we saw her face only through a pie.

questions.text: Who did Carla say was the father of her baby?
questions.explanation:
Marshall.

	Marshall was played by Marshall King. He was a very intelligent man and Carla wanted a man who would do good by her child. So she lied to Marshall and told him he was the father. She only slept with him once and it was for the purpose of lying to him.

questions.text: Who was the real father of Carla's baby?
questions.explanation:
Nick.

	Nick was Carla's ex-husband. He was not a very good father which was why Carla tried to trick Marshall.

questions.text: Carla had a bad day; what event topped it off?
questions.correct: It was her and Nick's anniversary.
questions.explanation:
It was her and Nick's anniversary.

	Carla was already having a bad day when he showed up and ended up sleeping with him. The result, she became pregnant with her 5th child.

Whitey.

	Diane had very pale skin and Carla referred to her as Whitey. She also has referred to her as Bleach Bag, and The Stick.

questions.text: What story did Diane tell Carla?
questions.explanation:
"The Tell-Tale Heart".

	"The Tell-Tale Heart" was a short story by Edgar Allan Poe. In the story the man killed another man because he couldn't stand the man's eye. He then buried him under the floor board of his house. He kept hearing the man's heart beat growing louder and louder until he couldn't take it anymore. He confessed what he did to the police and the sound of the heart beat went away. Diane told Carla this story to get her to tell Marshall the truth about the baby.

questions.text: When Diane asked Carla if the "babooms" were having any affect on her, what did Sam say?
options: "No, the babooms do not affect her at all."
"Maybe you should baboom a little louder."
questions.explanation:
"Maybe you need bigger babooms."

	Leave it to Sam to be thinking sexual thoughts. Diane kept babooming to remind Carla of the story she told her. She wanted Carla to feel guilty and tell Marshall the truth. Eventually, Carla heard the babooms without Diane saying anything. Overcome with guilt, she told Marshall the truth.

No.

	When Carla told Marshall the truth, he became angry. Sam tried to convince him to marry her anyway, but he refused.
